dict.string: A collection of keyboard shortcuts for common ZD actions

#!/usr/bin/env bash #forked from OneUpdater by Vitor Galvao https://github.com/vitorgalvao/alfred-workflows/blob/master/OneUpdater/README.md #This fork mostly removes unused features and also gives the option to store workflow files behind a private link. #This template configures automatic update notifications only, it cannot automatically install updates. #When an update is available, a URL is opened, linking the user to a page where they can download the latest update. #!This should be a page that will remain at the same URL or behind a redirect and can be updated in-place.! #!Failure to redirect users will result in an update notification loop.!
#Configure updates by filling in the following 6 variables ##This is the plist file that will be used for update checks. ##The script checks to see if the remote version greater than the version currently installed. ##If so, the user is notified and redirected to the workflow_url to download the latest update. readonly remote_info_plist='https://raw.githubusercontent.com/erikopinaldo/alfred-zendesk-shortcuts/main/info.plist' ##This is the link where the user will download the latest update. readonly workflow_url='https://app.slack.com/client/E12KS1G65/Qp:F0739LHNY5R' ##The amount of days between update checks. ##Change to 0 if testing and it will check every single time. ##!Don't forget to change it back before exporting! 4 days is recommended. readonly frequency_check='14' ##This homepage will be used only as a fallback if something goes wrong with the update checks. readonly home_page='https://app.slack.com/client/E12KS1G65/Qp:F0739LHNY5R'
#FROM HERE ON, CODE SHOULD BE LEFT UNTOUCHED!
readonly download_type='page'
function abort { open "${home_page}" notification 'Please check #watch-erik-code-things for a fix, or raise in channel' 'UPDATE SERVER ERROR' echo "${1}" >&2 exit 1 }
#check to see if the URL can be reached. If it can't a notification is posted below. function url_exists { curl --silent --location --output /dev/null --fail --range 0-0 "${1}" }
#Update notifications. Uses 'Notificator'. Either 'You're up to date' or 'Update available, redirecting you to download' function notification { local -r notificator="$(find . -type f -name 'notificator')" if [[ -f "${notificator}" && "$(/usr/bin/file --brief --mime-type "${notificator}")" == 'text/x-shellscript' ]]; then "${notificator}" --message "${1}" --title "CE Debug Tools for Alfred" --subtitle "${2}" --sound 'Funk' return fi
#use applescript for notifications if Notificator fails osascript -e "display notification \"${1}\" with title \"Alfred ${alfred_workflow_name} Updater \" subtitle \"${2}\"" }
# Local sanity checks. Creates a temporary file to compare with the remote version. readonly local_info_plist='info.plist' readonly local_version="$(/usr/libexec/PlistBuddy -c 'print version' "${local_info_plist}")"
[[ -n "${local_version}" ]] || abort 'You need to set a workflow version in the configuration sheet.'
# Check if the remote version can be reached if [[ $(find "${local_info_plist}" -mtime +"${frequency_check}"d) ]]; then if ! url_exists "${remote_info_plist}"; then abort "'remote_info_plist' (${remote_info_plist}) appears to not be reachable."; fi # Remote sanity check
#creates a temp file of the remote version to compare with the local version. readonly tmp_file="$(mktemp)" curl --location --output "${tmp_file}" "${remote_info_plist}" -H 'Accept: application/vnd.github.v3.raw' readonly remote_version="$(/usr/libexec/PlistBuddy -c 'print version' "${tmp_file}")"
#compare the local and remote files to see if an update is available. #if they're the, same notifies 'You are up to date!' and then resets the timer. if [[ "${local_version}" == "${remote_version}" ]]; then notification "(${remote_version}) You are up to date!" touch "${local_info_plist}" # Reset timer by touching local file exit 0 fi
if url_exists "${workflow_url}"; then notification "Update available v(${remote_version}) launching update page..." open "${workflow_url}" else abort "'workflow_url' (${workflow_url}) appears to not be reachable." fi fi

tell application "Google Chrome"
activate
-- Only execute on active tab set theTab to active tab of window 1
-- Only execute if tab is done loading repeat if (loading of theTab) is false then exit repeat end repeat
-- Only execute on active ticket (since ZD has its own tabbing system) execute theTab javascript " if (typeof tickets === 'undefined') { let tickets = document.getElementsByClassName('ember-view workspace') let ticketsArray = Array.from(tickets)
activeTicket = ticketsArray.filter(ticket => ticket.style.length === 0)[0] }
// Click assignee dropdown menu activeTicket.querySelectorAll(`[data-agent-workspace-onboarding-id='assigneeField']`)[0].click(); "
-- Click on Support assignee
delay 0.5
execute theTab javascript " activeTicket.getElementsByClassName('lkJzpj')[0].click(); "
end tell

tell application "Google Chrome"
activate
-- Only execute on active tab
set theTab to active tab of window 1
-- Only execute if tab is done loading repeat if (loading of theTab) is false then exit repeat end repeat
-- Only execute on active ticket (since ZD has its own tabbing system) execute theTab javascript "
// Click views refresh button document.querySelectorAll(`[data-test-id='views_views-list_header-refresh']`)[0].click();
"
end tell

Hi {var:split1},
Thanks for reaching out.
It looks like you are experiencing a bug that our engineers are aware of and need to investigate further. I had a look at the bug report and don't see any tangible updates on it yet, so I don't have a concrete resolution timeline to provide at the moment. However, I've linked your ticket to the bug report so that you are kept in the loop as updates come in.
Please let me know if you have any additional questions.
All the best, Erik

However, I've linked your ticket to the bug report so that you are kept in the loop as updates come in.
Please let me know if you have any additional questions.
All the best, Erik

1. Open your ZD view in browser 2. Get the VIEW_ID at the end of the URL 3. Double click this ">" block 4. Paste VIEW_ID into the ARGUMENT text field 5. Save

Note: return value has trailing CRLF. This needs to be trimmed in subsequent Alfred steps. For some reason, this Applescript isn't playing nice with trimming

GENERAL NOTE
You'll have to enter your own hotkeys/shortcuts for all of the flows below. To do this:
1. Double click a hotkey block 2. Press your desired hotkey combination
Only pass requesterName from previous split
NOTE: all snippets grab requester name from requester dropdown menu

Double click this block to edit snippet content. This snippet is pasted into the app in focus
Note: return value has trailing CRLF. This needs to be trimmed in subsequent Alfred steps. For some reason, this Applescript isn't playing nice with trimming
Note: return value has trailing CRLF. This needs to be trimmed in subsequent Alfred steps. For some reason, this Applescript isn't playing nice with trimming

HOW TO ADD MORE SNIPPETS:
There are 3 example snippet chains here. You can add more of your own by following these steps:
1. Drag your mouse to highlight one entire snippet chain 2. Command + C to copy that chain 3. Command + V to paste that chain. You can drag this dupe chain wherever you want 3. In this dupe chain, double click the beginning "Snippet" block to edit the keyword/shortcut for your snippet 4. Double click the "Copy to Clipboard" block to edit snippet text content

NOTE: These "Visit My X Tickets" flows work on any ZD page. You don't have to already be on a "view" page of ZD. For example, you could currently have a ticket open and still use these flows to visit a ZD view.
1. Open your ZD view in browser 2. Get the VIEW_ID at the end of the URL 3. Double click this ">" block 4. Paste VIEW_ID into the ARGUMENT text field 5. Save
Only pass requesterName from previous split
NOTE: You can delete or duplicate any of the "Visit My X Tickets" flows below based on your needs. The 3 flows below are just some examples of my most commonly visited custom views.
